Module edu.citadel.cprl
Package edu.citadel.cprl

Class IdTable

java.lang.Object
edu.citadel.cprl.IdTable
public final class IdTable extends Object
The identifier table (also known as a symbol table) is used to hold attributes of identifiers in the programming language CPRL.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    IdTable()
    Construct an empty identifier table with scope level initialized to 0.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    add(Declaration decl)
    Add a declaration to the current scope.

    closeScope()
    Closes the outermost scope.
    Declaration
    get(String idStr)
    Returns the declaration associated with the identifier name (type String).
    ScopeLevel
    getScopeLevel()
    Returns the current scope level.
    void
    openScope(ScopeLevel scopeLevel)
    Opens a new scope for identifiers.

  • Constructor Details

    • IdTable

      public IdTable()
      Construct an empty identifier table with scope level initialized to 0.

  • Method Details

    • getScopeLevel

      public ScopeLevel getScopeLevel()
      Returns the current scope level.

    • openScope

      public void openScope(ScopeLevel scopeLevel)
      Opens a new scope for identifiers.

    • closeScope

      public void closeScope()
      Closes the outermost scope.

    • add

      public void add(Declaration decl) throws ParserException
      Add a declaration to the current scope.
      Throws:
      ParserException - if the name in the declaration already exists in the current scope.

    • get

      public Declaration get(String idStr)
      Returns the declaration associated with the identifier name (type String). Returns null if the identifier is not found. Searches enclosing scopes if necessary.
